metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32055 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
Mutt 1.11.0 through 2.0.x before 2.0.7 (and NeoMutt 2019-10-25 through2021-05-04) has a $imap_qresync issue in which imap/util.c has anout-of-bounds read in situations where an IMAP sequence set ends with acomma. NOTE: the $imap_qresync setting for QRESYNC is not enabled bydefault.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mutt - 1.13.2-1ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mutt package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.2-1ubuntu0.5').
neomutt package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
